text: Fra flaske på Mi2 (sommeravslutning) på Cardinal juni-17: kullsort med kort beige skum. Suveren aroma og smak med ekstrem fylde. Snop de luxe. Alkoholen merkes først bakerst i ganen. Ikke vaniljepreget tross fatlagringen, den er bare superbalansert. En nytelse fra første til siste dråpe, og den var kveldens aller beste (sammen med Struise Pannepot Grand Reserva 2009). 8-3-9-5-18.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2017 Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours black with no head. Aroma of dark chocolate, chocolate, pralines, some vanilla, some ethanol. Tastes sweet with little bitterness. Medium bodied, smooth mouth feel, some alcoholic warmth.
UPDATED: JUN 19, 2017 so much coffee... dark chocolate, milk chocolate, some sweet cherries. maybe a bit too one-dimensional. a bit of chili, barely detectable.

Bottle at home. Very intense aroma of chocolate and liquorice. Taste very alike - dark chocolate, liquorice, salt, whisky, molasses, charcoal and chilli. Smooth mouthfeel to start with but with a small attack of heavy roasted taste and small/medium dry/tart bitterness in aftertaste.

Pite z beczki @ AleBrowar Wrocław 09.06.17. Piwo brązowe, chyba nieprzejrzyste, ciemno było... Piana dośc trwała, drobna, zdobi szkło, ulatnia sie powoli. W aromatach nic nie zapowiada petardy w smakach - mocna kawa, czekolada, wanilia, trochę wędzonych śliwek, prażonych orzechów włoskich. W smaku unikalny, wyjątkowy mix kawy o ziemistych nutach, mocnej wanilii, bardzo szlachetnej, zero sztuczności, mleczna i gorzka czekolada, daktyle, wspaniała słodycz, bez zaklejania. Piwo niezwykle aksamitne, oleiste, szlachetne, zdecydowanie warte pieniędzy. Jedno z najlepszych jakie miałem okazję pić.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark opaque brown pour with a thin tan head, aroma has light whiskey, vanilla and chocolate, taste has sweet chocolate, vanilla, charred roast, whiskey, warming alcohol, oily mouthfeel, very good.

Pours pitch, next to no head, viscous, low carbonation. Wood like a cigar box, spice, vanilla, chocolate aroma - sweet. V full body - oily and mouth coating. Very nice balance on tasting. Dark malts, very obvious booze,dark chocolate. Nice long warming bitter coffee and bourbon vanilla finish. Given a chequered history with evil twin, a pleasant surprise. Decent

So much better than basic bible belt. Aroma could have a bit more vanilla, but there is some beautiful cocoa and chocolate notes along with a bit of chillies and some coffee in the background. Taste is smooth, rather sweet with a bit of spiciness to counter it. Very enjoyable bottle.

33 cl bottle, served in snifter. Poured black as midnight on a moonless night with a small half finger mocha tan head. Aroma is amazing: coffee, chocolate and whisky straight away, then vanilla, dark fruit, spices and bakers cocoa. Taste is even better: dark chocolate, whisky, dark roasted espresso beans, vanilla, peppers, dark fruit, molasses, soy sauce, mocha, salty licorice, fudge, caramel, roasted nuts, bread, baking cocoa, chocolate raisins, dates. Incredible full, gloopy mouthfeel, just awesome. Full body with a superroasted bittersweet finish. One of the best RIS Ive tasted, just friggin dilicious and a beautiful experience that I will cherish...

Aroma:

Heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wood, vanilla, chocolate, mocha, roasted malts, coffee and spices.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with no/a slight dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, wood, vanilla, chocolate and mocha; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts, coffee and spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Lovely vanilla and a dash of mocha with a bucket full of spices at the finish. Perfect at everything but the aroma, that is very close to reaching this point.

Frisch vom Hahn bei der BGM 01 in Wroclaw getrunken. Fast schwarz mit dichter brauner Schaumkrone. In der Nase Noten von frisch gemahlenen Kaffee. Gut ausgeprägter Körper, der von edlen Kaffee- und Noten von dunkler Schokolade geprägt ist.

Bottle 355ml, a dark beer with copper head. Nose is intense on dark chocolate and roasted malt, sugar. Aroma is on dark caramel, coffee, espresso, dark chocolate, vanilla, blond caramel, quite sweet, smooth and oily, slightly spicy, very intense, sweet vanilla finish, not too hopy.

Ahogyan az egy Prairie főzettől elvárható, bővérű, vadóc természete már a kinézete alapján is egyértelművé válik, szurokfekete színben, olajos lenyomatot hagyva érkezik a pohárba az ördögi ital. Jómagam azt az álláspontot képviselem, hogy ami jó, az soha nem lehet unalmas, pláne, ha ennyire kiváló főzetről van szó. Éppen ezért legyen bár akármennyire ismerős a karakter, amit a pikánsan fűszeres, kakaós-vaníliás görgeteg aromái képviselnek, nálam minden alkalommal szívesen látott vendégnek számítanak. A kirobbanó kakaótartalmú étcsokoládé sötét mondanivalója, a vanília csillapítólag ható, bársonyos jellege, majd a csili pajkos pikantériája olyan kompozíciót alkotnak a Prairie mestereinek kezei között, amelyhez egyébként kevesen értenek, s bár valóban rendre visszatérő elemek a főzeteikben, minden sörben valahogy másként festenek. Ebben a típusban valami parfümös, ízében is illatos kicsengés társul a felsorolt jegyekhez, melyek összesimulását az érlelésből adódó méltóságteljes karakter biztosítja, mely által egy elegáns, illatszeresen fás, roppant izgalmas és egyedi jelleg bontakozik ki. Lenyűgöző imperial stout, megérdemelt helye van a top 50-es mezőnyben.

Flaska från Beergium. Delad med JoacimMvp. Kolsvart, tjock vätska med liten brunbiege skumkrona. Massiv doft med löjliga mängder av mörk choklad, kakaonibs, fräsch och fruktig grön chili, kaffe, ekfat, toffee, whisky, marsipan, mandel och lite nötiga inslag, kakdeg, kladdkaksdeg. Jag luktar i tomflaskan som står kvar sen gårdagen och det doftar som en liten marsipangris som blivit doppad i lager efter lager av mörk choklad med alla möjliga sötsaker i. Kroppen är massiv, som förväntat. Smaken är som doften. Det enda som någorlunda håller sötman i schack är fatkaraktären, som bidrar med lite ektoner och strävhet. Löjligt gott.

30cl van de tap bij Zeezicht, Breda
Alcoholpercentage van 13%
Uitgetapt in Zeezicht glas 

Uiterlijk: zwart met kleine cremelaag

Aroma en smaak: neus is heerlijk cacao, smaak is melkchocolade, koffie, gebrande mouten, donker fruit, redelijke bitter, lekker zoete twist, volle afdronk chili, BA is subtiel maar lekker

Conclusie: heerlijke stout

12oz bottle at home. No obvious BB date. black color, very small coffee colored head. smells vanilla, earthy, bit green herbal, spices, light booze, coffee, light wood. very nice smell. full body, light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes earthy, vanilla, licorice, light booze, some bitter chocolate, spices, peppery notes, light wood. finishes lightly sweet with earthy notes, vanilla and some bitter chocolate. very nice one, a bit hot from the alcohol, but very drinkable overall.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Pours a syrupy, opaque black with a small, light brown head. Nose is cloyingly sweet, the barrel can hardly add to this extremely thick, spicy and potent brew. Very rich body, hardly any carbonation. Loads of chocolate and spice while the Bourbon adds a subtle vanillaish edge and also adds even more alcohol heat. A bit much, more like a chocolate dessert. 300517

Bottle. Pours opaque black with no head. Noticeably thick viscosity observed. Aroma is fudge, chocolate, vanilla, wafer. Taste is fudge sweet, chocolate sweet, hint of cocoa, vanilla bourbon sweet, hint of oak, a bit of ice cream cone wafer action, sweet coffee. Thick, oily mouthfeel.

Mleczna czekolada, paloność, trochę kawy zbożowej, beczkowe klimaty dość intensywne, ale nie dominujące (na szczęście), dużo wanilii, migdałów, pralinek, trochę kukułki (pozdrawiam Kororowe Szyszki). W smaku słodko, paloność próbuje się przebić, jakby była nieco bardziej intensywna, bym się nie obraził, piwo jest mocno wyklejające, dawka 0,33l byłaby już zdecydowanie muląca. Na finiszu likierowo (amaretto, czkolada) i nieco tanin.

12 oz. bottle. Inky black with the slightest bit of dark mocha bubbles. Smells of peppers, which are a little green, something like coffee, chocolate, bourbon, and a lot of sweetness. Tastes of rich chocolate, fudge, bourbon, oak, vanilla. Cinnamon and peppers cuts the sugar nicely. Very heavy and boozy. Really rich, but very tasty.

Pite na Urusie. Świetnie złożone i zbalansowane piwo. Świetna i intensywna kawa z czekoladą, nie wybijająca się paloność, lekka papryczka na finiszu. Wszystko świetnie się uzupełnia, pierwsze moje paprykowe piwo, które da się wypić ze smakiem.

Barwa czarna, piana brunatna, redukuje się do obrączki.
Aromat intensywny, na pierwszym planie przyprawy z wyczuwalną papryką. Gorzka czekolada, kawa espresso, nuty likiery czekoladowego i niuanse whisky.
W smaku gęste i potężne. Gorzka czekolada w płynie, kawa, kakao, praliny, przyprawy korzenne, papryczki lekko rozgrzewają na finiszu. Wanilia i szlachetny alkohol przyjemnie puentują trunek.

12 ounce bottle, not sure how much liquid was actually inside though, who knows really .. mild barrel, wood, tar, tinglers, alcohol .. barrel seems to have thinned this out quite a bit, still good though .. . the cemetery is full of people who had the right of way.

The aroma is amazing, if this were an aftershave I would wear it every day. A deep indulgent coffee and chocolate taste followed by a lovely warming liquorice palate. Dark, lovely, complex, and enveloping. Lovely. This beer is awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Coffee, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, chilli in nose. Pours pitch black with tan head. Taste is sweet with lots of chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, licorice, pralines. Medium bitter finish with some chilli burning, full body, soft carbonation. Overall very good, dangerously drinkable, smooth and balanced.

Bottle split 2 ways. Pours pitch black with a small bubbly brown and quickly dissapearing head. Aromas of chili, peppery coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate. Taste has lots of cocoa, chili spice, fruitiness, vanilla, milk chocolate, fudge.
Bottle - pours black. Nose has green pepper, bourbon and chocolate. Taste has a nice balance fudginess, oak, vanilla and pepper but not spicy or overpowering.
Bottle. Hints of green pepper on the nose. Sweet with loads of booze. Chocolate, muted expresso, and oak. Hints of chili and vanilla. Good body and mouthfeel.
Looks like used car oil. Aroma is thick and viscous, and sweet. The flavor is a bit chocolaty and a little vanilla. Quite tasty.
Donker bruine kleur. Geur is sterk alcoholisch, zoet en houtig. Smaak is alcoholisch en sterk peperig en heeft iets weg van coffie.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2017 Bottle. Pours black , small grey head fades fast. Smell is intense, bit peppers, some oak, mild spices. Taste is very ful, creamy, some heat of the peppers. Very silky, smooth, highly intensified black malts. Some barrel notes. Bit boozy. Nice

On tap at RateBeer Best. Pours black with medium tan head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is strong roast, cocoa, peppers, wood, bourbon, vanilla. Thick, chewy, roasted malt, similar flavors to nose, dark chocolate, light spice, nice boozy finish, enjoyed this.

Draught @ Café Zeezicht, Breda. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized brown colored head that lasts for a decent while. Aroma is malts, dark malts, heavy chocolate, espresso mellowed down and mixed with dark chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, a hint of herbs or spices that fortunately is far enough in the background not to annoy me. Taste malts, dark malts, chocolate, mocha, vanilla, bourbon, bitter. Full body, thick oily texture, suitable decently soft carbonation. Awesome beer.

Piana niewielka, sycząca, szybko opada mizernej firanki. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Aromat przyjemny, jest intensywna i szlachetna kawa, kakao, praliny, wanilia i ewidentnie papryczki... W smaku mamy powtórkę, piwo jest słodkie, lepkie, średnio gęste, każda ze składowych wyrazista, niczego nie trzeba się doszukiwać. Goryczka nieduża, chili delikatnie pikantne w dalekim aftertejsie, alkohol perfekcyjnie wkomponowany, niskie wysycenie.

Bez dwóch zdań #teamslodyczka i bez dwóch zdań mi to odpowiada. W porównaniu z wersją podstawową piwo jest bardziej ułożone, intensywniej waniliowe i mniej pikantne. Klasa, choć do pełni szczęścia zabrakło nieco więcej body.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2017 On tap at The Craft Beer Co St Mary Axe. Black beer lasting tan head. Roasted malt dark Belgian chocolate a little espresso coffee some wood character. Rich complex aroma. Very attractive. Given the abv this is a bit of a sipper. Now i am not always impressed by high abv big intense barrel aged imperial stouts. And the aromais good . It?s too hot for a start. Even for a sipping beer. The heat reminds me of ginger nut biscuits. The aroma is complex and delicious . The flavours in the mouth become tarry oily before a slightly harsh heat ginger finish. So apart from the aroma not be that great for me. Alcohol is certainly entertaining though. Heat on finish leaves me cold.

Bottle from beergium. Dark dark dark color. Very thin head. Medium body. Very smooth carbonation. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Aroma and flavour is chocolate, coffee, licorice, chili, vanilla, whisky. Pretty good.

On tap at Himmeriget. Black with a small tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, bourbon, some vanilla and hints of dried fruit. The same in the taste, also some spices. The body was full and the mouthfeel kind of smooth. Tasty.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2017 W aromacie espresso, ziarna kawy, nuty whiskey, sporo kakao, trochę przyprawowości, chili, bardzo ułożony i szlachetny zapach. W wyglądzie czarne z obrączką beżowej piany. W smaku mocna kawa, gorzkie kakao, chili, wyraźne nuty whiskey, trochę alkoholu, nie do końca ułożone jak na mój gust. Rozgrzewające po każdym łyku, gęste, bardzo degustacyjne. Ogólnie świetny aromat, spora intensywność, bogate w smaku, byłby ideał gdyby alkohol był bardziej schowany, ale i tak świetne piwo.
Tap black colour with off beige head.Aroma of Bourbon and vanilla,smooth and creamy with hint of coffee and Wood cremy and Warming smooth finish.

Zapach czekolada mleczna, cynamon, słonecznik, kawa inka.
W smaku slodko, duzo kakao, lekki dąb, beczka drewniana, kawa zbożowa.

Tap @Himmeriget. Black, small light tan head. Aroma has coffee and bourbon, some syrupy notes and wood. Light vanilla. Thick, slick mouthfeel. Coffee and choc flavour with nice alc bite. Dry. Carb is near flat. Long, warm coffee and bourbon finish.

Tap @ Himmeriget. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet roasted amlt, heavy coffee and vegetables. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily. 110517

Draught. Pitch black colooured. Dense light brown head. Aroma. Roast, coffee, liqourice choco. Flavour. Roast. Sweetness, herbs, choco, alc, molasses, and then some. Medium to full bodied. Ends roasted and herbal
Keg at himm. Thingy ma bob... Soft chocolate roast malts.. Big spiced chocolate roast malts nose.. Dark dry chocolate roast.. Big spice.. Rich chocolate roast.. Heavy chocolate malts

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, cedar wood, ancho chilli. Taste is mild sweet up front followed by a basement richness turning sweet again in the finish. Immensely complex, wonderfully rich. Full bodied and creamy with soft carbonation.

Draft at Himmeriget. Pours black with a small beige head. Nice cocoa, chocolate, tonka, vanilla, bourbon. Good amount of spice to it from the chillies, lots of flavor not too much heat. Classic Prairie profile.
Dark chocolate, raisins, dried fruit. Could be served as port. Good for a third. Intense shit.

Bottle, batch 1, fridge-aged for a few months, drunk 4/1/17.Dark ebony pour, undetermined clarity, seemingly opaque, with a tan head atop showing strong retention.Fudge is strong in this one, as expected, though its not a booze bomb, thankfully. Moderate oak and spicy whiskey mixing with dark fruits and a long coffee and fudge finish. Like with BA Bomb!, the barrel-aging is pretty well-done (one of the few things Prairie seems to do well) without any intense, over-the-top toasted oak, huge wood tannin or beat-you-to-death bourbon characteristics. Alcohol is moderately-well concealed (underneath all of that fudge) and the beer certainly comes off muddled given all the crap they put in this. But by and large, pretty inoffensive with a few pleasant aspects (the coffee and vanilla character is balanced and enjoyable, the dark fruit character is a nice touch, and I suppose its not one of the biggest offenders when it comes to syrup/fudge/sugar level).Still a thick, rich, moderately fudgey flavor and malty texture with low, moderately-engaging carbonation and a good bit of spicy whiskey and light oak. Between the vanilla, whiskey and wood, it definitely produces some pineapple-coconut character, but its held at bay by the chili and fudgey mix of base and dark malt. Over-the-top, but not quite syrupy and at least one can sense some attempt was made at attenuation. Still, I dont find anything particularly compelling here, nor any bit of finesse or quality brewing and its yet another overdone monster that has me scratching my head at how people consider this Top 50 material.

Big thanks to Greg for sending this bottle! Pours a chocolate shade of black with a 2 finger brown colored head that breaks into small lace and a ring around the glass. Aromas of wet oak and bourbon, initially. Cocoa, malt balls, dry bakers chocolate, faint peppers, black olive and light vanilla. Taste is a bit hot out of the gate but balances as it warms. Loads of cocoa, fudge and vanilla sweetness that is muted by a very slight pepper spice and very present bourbon character. Medium body, medium roast, light smoke. Finishes with a bitter chocolate and bourbon touch. Tasty!

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2017 Keg at Craft Clerkenwell. It pours jet black with minimal head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, oak, big vanilla, spicy, green chilli, cacao nibs, resin, roasted malt, toffee and fudge. The taste is rich, slick, chewy malt, chocolate, spicy, wood, vanilla fudge, cacao, honey, spice, chocolate bar and some warming booze with a slick finish. Full body, fine carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Rich, yet well rounded. Good fun.

Barrel aged variant of a beer that quite literally holds the middle between Bomb! and Even More Jesus - sounds like a guarantee for success. Thin, deep yellow beige, lightly lacing head, immediately opening in the middle with a couple of small tan islands, eventually all but vanishing; jet black colour with a hazy burgundy tinge only visible less than one millimeter off the edge. Intense, complex and utterly mouthwatering bouquet of a whole lot of bitter black chocolate, mocha ice cream, old furniture-like wood (quite pronounced), dusty old newspapers even, bourbon, dried jalapeño peppers, courgette skin, dried porcini, vanilla beans and even vanilla ice cream, candied figs, varnish or shoe polish, hints of caramel sauce, vague soy sauce or even a faint touch of fish sauce, brown bread crumbs, Belgian chocolates, dried banana slices, freshly roasted coffee beans, old leather, dust. Intense onset with pungent candied sweetness as the main star, rum-soaked raisins, candied figs and black cherries, the latter effect providing some underlying sourishness, thin porcini-like umami edge; soft carbonation, viscous, thick and oily mouthfeel, very heavy. The mouth cavity is soon coated with a wealth of blackness: roasted chestnuts, bitter chocolate, burnt toast - an abyss of deep, bittersweet maltiness, more sweet than bitter but in the end dried by roasted bitterness (a tad coffee-like but not too much so, as it lies covered under the cocoa nibs), a lot of beautiful oak (almost as in old oak furniture) releasing vanilla-ish retronasal aromas which are splendidly highlighted by the actual vanilla beans, spicy and adequately bittering hops camouflaging in all this bitter, black maltiness, and, unsurprisingly, a whole lot of heating end alcohol stretching for a long distance into the throat and in the end, effectively tasting like bourbon. This alcoholic heat is not just due to the alcohol itself: the dried chili peppers, though used with care, add a soft but unmistakable burn in the end. I can see how this black concoction scores so high on this site: this is a cleverly composed masterpiece with different pieces of the puzzle matching each other wonderfully. The oak is reinforced by the vanilla, the bourbon by the chili, the malts by the cocoa nibs - its as if each component has been highlighted by another one. A tad too boozy for my personal taste perhaps, but that is just nitpicking and I have experienced the same issue with other great American stouts so I will not be bothered by that - I should have known better and cellar it till next winter instead of opening this on a warm and brightly sunlit May afternoon. Absolutely world class, that much is clear.
12oz bottle pours black with thin tan head aroma is strong cocoa, vanilla and whiskey taste is more of the same with peppery finish awesome

Bottle bought @ Beergium. Motor oil black pour with a thin dark chocolate brown head. Roasty nose with plenty of burnt malts, coffee, cocoa nibs, charcoal & mellow vanilla bourbon barrel. Lots of coffee & bitter chocolate. Sweet, bitter, malty & roasty taste with plenty of mellow bourbon barrel. Soft, round & fairly velvety mouthfeel. Looks like motor oil but the mouthfeel rather is fairly drinkable. Coffee, bitter chocolate & barrel all the way through. Very good roasty BA impy.

(355ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, May 5/17) Pours black with a moderate, well-lasting pale brown head and some lace. Aroma of dark caramel, chocolate, vanilla, a bit of smoky chili, oak, light to moderate roasted bitterness with notes of coffee and cacao, soft to moderate whiskey and char, oak, leather, light spicebox. Flavour is silky smooth dark chocolate, toffee, vanilla, smooth smooth whiskey, balanced coffee bitterness, subtle spicebox and chili smoke, oak, light char, umami soy notes, a little anise. A bit sweet to start, moderately dry in the finish with whiskey, bittering coffee and roasted grain, and a bit more chili and spice prominence, lingering chocolate. No alcohol. Medium full and silky smooth in the mouth with soft carbonation. More of a subtle and well balanced stout than something in your face, but its a very calculated use of barrel to augment the base beer. Very nice.

A: Deep dark brown/black coloured, no head N: Green peppers, chili, scotch, rye bread, soy sauce T: Rye bread, soy, bitter chocolate, vanilla, hint of cardamom, light hint of cloves O: Very nice balanced spicyness to it. Quite sweet, but still well balanced O: On the edge of too sweet, but still very nice!
Spicy coming from peppers cannot be unnoticed however its quite moderate and even pleasant. Very good job.

Notes from April 6, 2017. Pours nearly black; no light passes. Tan khaki head fades to the edge of the glass. Aroma is sweet and spicy: dark chocolate, vanilla and a spicy complexity. Carbonation is soft, mouthfeel is thick and smooth. Prominent bourbon barrel finish. Delicious.

Z nalewaka na WFP, słyszałem że z butelki jest zupełnie inne.

FE-NO-ME-NA-LNE. 
Zdecydowanie najlepsze piwo, jakie do tej pory piłem. Zwykle nie lubię piw z pikantnymi dodatkami, ale tutaj papryczek dodano idealnie tyle, ile trzeba. 
Nie wiem właściwie jak je opisać.
On tap at Dunkbar. Black with a lasting tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, fresh ground coffee, caramel and vanilla. Sweet flavour of dark chocolate, coffee and vanilla with warm alcohol.

Bottle from Bierland Katowice

Dark pour. Dry roasted some spice aroma. Taste follows, slight chillies, but not super hot. Nice aroma of bourbon, vanilla, carmel and some coffee. Really great!

(on tap @ Dunkbar) Poured into snifter at "Mikkeller Bar temperature" reveals a pitch black body with less than one finger of tan head that fades leaving lace. Decent regeneration. As it warms the beer yields notes of bourbon vanilla, dark chocolate mousse, roast malt and chipotle-like spices. Creamy texture, soft carbonation, full body and a sweet and smoky, warming subtle chili finish. ABV is masked very well and is matched well by the complexity of the aroma and flavour profile. Spice is integrated well with bourbon and yields harmonic aroma and flavour. Coffee is perhaps faintly detectable as a slightly ascerbic note in the taste but otherwise is blended in well with the chili, bourbon and roasted malt.

Sample @ Dunkbar. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of bourbon, ryebread, vanilla, loads choko, licorice, light soy. Taste is heavy bourbon, chokolade, soy and heavy licorice, heavy a bit boozy, good supper.
Tap @ dunkbar. Black body with a small offwhite head. Bourbon, roasted malt, chocolate, cocoa, oak, red/dark berry notes. Lovely.
Przepisane z untappd w ramach uzupełnienia profilu. Etykieta nie kłamie - kakao, wanilia, delikatne papryczki, podlane beczką po wskiskey. Prairie kolejny raz dostarczyło.

Wygląd: nieprzejrzyscie czarne. 
Piana: bezowa drobnopecherzykowa, szybko się redukuje. 
Aromat: bardzo złożony, czekolada, kawa, wanilia, do tego dębowa beczka. Po prostu mega. 
Smak: czekolada, kawa, wanilia i pojawiajaca sie po chwili lekka ostrosc od chilli. 
Goryczka: stednia, podbita alkoholem i chilli. 
Wysycenie: niskie
Cialo: pelne. 
Co tu napisac. Bardzo złożony świetny RIS. Mega aromatyczny, o bogatym smaku. Alkohol dobrze ukryty, choć rozgrzewa w przełyk ale to zasługa dodatku w postaci chilli. Jeden z lepszych barrel aged jakie piłem. 
Szanuje. !!!


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, bottled on June 2016. Poured into a snifter.

Aroma: bourbon, dark belgian chocolate, very intensive vanilla, oxidation notes.

Pours jet black. Almost no head, all is left is beige. 

Heavy sweetness, medium heavy bitterness. "Śliwka Nałęczowska w czekoladzie" Prunes covered chocolate. A hint of coffee. Wow.

Very heavy bodied, oily, sticky, chewy. Oily, completely flat. This is one of the most gourmandish RIS Ive drunk. 

Wow. Just wow.

Bottle from The Growler Spot. Black as night with a sudsy dark almost reddish-brown head. Aroma of chili peppers, chocolate, whiskey barrel, coffee, and vanilla. Tastes super rich; spicy, woody, sweet, boozy and bitter. Full bodied and creamy smooth. Hallelujah.

Piwo bliskie ideału. Od razu powiem, że oceniam wersję beczkową. Wersji butelkowej dałem chyba ok 3.7/5 - było zbyt wytrawne i zbyt pikantne jak na moje gusta. Pite ostatnio z beczki U Fotografa powaliło mnie na kolana.

Aromat - trufle, czekolada, kokos, lekka wanilia; intensywny.
Ciało średnio pełne, alkohol szczypie w przełyk.
Mocno czekoladowe, kakaowe z kokosem.

Jet black in appearance with a frothy mocha head. Molasses, oak, vanilla, cocoa powder, and dark roasted coffee. Not getting a ton of the capsaicin or chili impact. Nose is rich and full of bourbony goodness. Chewy and filling. A hint of warmth as it moves down the gullet. Yum!

Barwa smoliście czarna,piana gęsta, brązowa. Genialny aromat kawowo waniliowy, gorzkiej czekolady, po ogrzaniu wchodzą nuty podobne do orzechów włoskich. Jest gęściutkie, alkohol rozgrzewa momentalnie, czuć też nuty podobne do ziemistych prawdopodobnie od papryczek chilii, sporo kakao, ale samo piwo nie jest jakoś mocno słodkie, jest bardzo dobrze zbalansowane.
Aroma is vinous, dark malts, mild whiskey and mostly sludgy. The flavor is dark malts, sludge, mild whiskey and a mix of acidic and warming alcohol in the finish.

Aroma: bourbon vanilla, wood, chocolate, licorice, coffee, gentle caramel - extremely well balanced, smells like pralines dipped in bourbon. 
Appearance: black, hints of dark brown at the edges, no head at all 
Taste: medium sweet at the beginning, with all the aromas mentioned above, turns suddenly to medium-dry after a second. Very thick mouthfeel. Wish it was a bit sweeter. 
Palete is wonderfully complex. 
Overall: Hint of more sugar would have made it perfect

Aromat mocno czekoladowy, kakaowy i przyjemnie przyprawy. Przyjemnie czuć papryczki i delikatnie alkohol. Smak wytrawny, olbrzymia ilość kakao, gorzkiej czekolady. Po ogrzaniu beczkowosc, wanilia i praliny. Wytrawny wyrazisty gesty. Papryczek których nie lubię w piwie na szczęście zbytnio nie czuć. Takie mocno degustacyjne, nie da się go łatwo i szybko wypić. Alkohol szlachetny, ukryty, lekko grzeje w gardło.

tap/weźże. czarne jak smoła, delikatna, brązowa, drobnopęcherzykowa piana utrzymująca się do końca picia. aromat kakao, słodkiej czekolady, wanilli, ostrej papryki, szlachetnego alkoholu, po ogrzaniu wyraźne drewno oraz nuty popiołu. w smaku pełne, gładkie, słodkie, ale nie wyklejające, na finiszu potężna gorzka czekolada, nuty popiołowe na finiszu. genialne piwo

Tap Wezze Krafta. Jet black, low head. Aroma: intense cocoa, coffee, nuts, hint of vanilla. Taste. Dark choclate, vanilla, marzipan, coffee. Rich and complex. Sweet, medium body, flat carbonation. Peppers in aftertaste.

Multiple pours from tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a pitch black with a nice, small, dark tan head. Aroma has lots of bourbon, slight spices, lots of heavy dark chocolate, somewhat roasty, toffee, vanilla. Taste is sweet, lots of dark chocolate, light bitterness, light boozy, some chili heat, but not as much spices as the regular one. Has the same full body and a very nice balance. Rather low carbonation. Well done!

Butelka i tap na Warszawskim Festiwalu Piwa. Przepiękny aromat czekolady, pralin, wanilii, bourbona, kawy, kakao, no cuda. Smak dosyć słodki, jest lekka kontra palona. W smaku czekolada, wanilia, kakao. Nuta alkoholu. Posmak palony, przyjemny i niezbyt długi, Piękne piwo. Butelka nie odstaje od kranu.

Draft glass at Warszawski Festiwal Piwa17 - day 2, split with 77ships. 
Noire, col café au lait, dorée au verre.
Arôme met doffice une belle dose de malts en avant avec des effluves de chocolat et mélasse et accompagnement de crystal, Bourbon est là avec once de douceur vanillée, petite touche herbacée des houblons perce en rétro.
Palais est épais, chocolaté, grillé, chocolate fudge et en poudre, Bourbon en retrait mais suffisant que pour être noté.
Épaisseur ajoutée de lavoine, et le tout est un peu over the top, fini café avec effet de crème glacée.

355 ml bottle from Beergium.
Black, oily body, with a small, dense, a bit lacing, coffee-colored head.
Very rich, complex aroma of melting dark chocolate, brownie, wood, coffee, liquorice, tobacco, whisky, cocoa, coconut, vanilla, some chili.
Tastes similar, also very rich and dense, with some more alcohol, but not too overpowering.
Full, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes roasty, medium dry, warming, wooden, subtly sweet, with dark chocolate, cocoa powder, liquorice, some tobacco, slight spices.

Delicious! Extremely rich and complex, with a great balance, strong and warming, but still really smooth to drink considering the ABV. Layers of dark chocolate and other sweet notes, combined with just enough roastiness and perfectly integrated whiskey barrel. Outstanding example of a BA Imperial Stout!

Aroma: chocolate, roasted dark malts, whisky barrel.
Appearance: jetblack and brown head.
Taste: spicy, barrel notes, roasted dark malts, wet wood, warming alcohol, slightly peated, chocolate, cocoa, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, barrel finish.
Overall: great complex beer, alcohol should be better covered.

Piana be?owa niewielka i opada szybko. Kolor czarny. Aromat gorzka czekolada, mleczna czekolada, kakao, wanilia, kokos, praliny, wyra?na beczka. Alkohol na szlachetna nut? wyczuwalny, wy?mienity. 
Smak, o kurcze ale to dobre, powtórka z aromatów, piwo pe?ne cia?a, odpowiednio s?odkie, du?o czekolady i kakao, stare drewna, palone s?ody daj?ce kwaskowe nuty(nie kwa?ne). W strukturze g?adkie, oleiste, wysycenie niskie, alkohol u?o?ony lekko wyczuwalny na szlachetn? nut?, goryczka zaznaczona. Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pitch black with a dark tan head. Notes of all the adjuncts! Tons of vanilla, sweet cocoa, coconut, chocolate and caramel. Good stuff!

O Boże... Cudownie ułożony i zbalansowany Imperial Stout. Praliny, wanilia, gorzka i mleczna czekolada, kawa, lekkie ciemne owoce, szlachetny alkohol (ale bardzo delikatny, jedynie w aromacie). Totalnie ułożone i gładkie w smaku, kremowe w ustach, alkohol czuć dopiero w żołądku i głowie. Fantastyczne piwo, niesamowite że trafiło na półki!

Draft @ Beer Temple, sample size. Black color. Brown head, small. Aromas of hard roasted malts, booze, whiskey, dark chocolate, light fruit. Retronasal its boozy, sweet, roasted, chocolate, fruity, woody. Flavor is above moderate sweet, chocolate, roasted. Quite full bodied. Drinks deceptively easy for its 13%. Long finish, boozy, whiskey-ish, woody. Good stuff!

Bottle.Pours pitch black with beige head.Full mouthfeel with low carbonation.Amazing aroma of chocolate ,roast and hints of whiskey and vanilla.Taste is amazing.Tons of chocolate, vanilla, coffee and a hint of spices amazingly blending with the whiskey.One of the best prairie beers ive had since now.

sample from bottle, poured a oily dark black colour with a tanned head. nose of dark roasted malts, sweet cacao, vanilla cream, sweet campfire bourbon, marshmallows, light chilli notes in the notes. taste is smooth, chocolate, perfect heat, sweet bourbon, charred oak, toffee, and fudge. mouthfeel is thick and chewy. loved it

Bottle. Strong aroma of coffee. Tate is quite interesting - also coffee dominates, but its very well balanced with other flavors: nuts, chocolate, vanilla. I only got some hints of chillis at the end of drinking beer, when it was a bit warmer.

Thank you for sharing Sebletitje! Sampled draft @ Warsaw Beer Festival Spring 2017. Black, little head. Nose is very sweet bourbon, excessively sweet, sugar, bourbon, chocolate syrup, almost feels artificial, lactose, sugar. taste is very sweet vanilla, sugar, candy, faint umami, diabetes, stupid sweet & almost cartoonish near artificial tasting but very nice all the same, great hugely sweet chocolate syrup & bourbon fun. Body is very thick chocolate syrup. Nearly the same score as the base not 4.5 vs 4.6 which doesnt mean much except that I liked them about the same. I would say no need to shell out for the BA version but no one is ever going to listen.
WFP Backlog. Chocolate, vanilla, coffee, marshmallows, butterscotch, roasty. Medium to heavy sweet, light bitter.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2017 (on tap )
Aroma:intensive mixture of coffee and coconut,vanilla,hint of roasted malt.
Taste: sweet,flavour of coffee,vanilla, coconut and milk chocolate,coconuty finish,coffee/roasty aftertaste.
Palate:full body,almost no carbonation,hint of booz.
Overall:Very good,coffee-driven brew with gentle barrel notes,Coffee adds some complexity on the other hand makes a bit one-dimensional.
Bible Belt BA mocno kawowe piwo i dużo beczki, whisky, czekolady. Plus papryczki. Można je kroić nożem.

Kolor: czarny z belikatnymi rubinowymi refleksami.
Piana: średnio wysoka, drobnopęcherzykowa, niezbyt trwała.
Zapach: sporo aromatów kawy, kakao, wyraźna wanilia, intensywny aromat whisky, trochę beczki, drewna, wyczuwalny alkohol.
Smak: spora pełnia, dość gęste, gładkie, wyraźna słodycz, taj jak w aromacie sporo nut kawy, kakao, wanilii, wyraźne nuty whisky, trochę beczki i drewna, średnia goryczka, kawowa, wyraźny alkohol.
Wysycenie: w kierunku średniego.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 Bottle. Pitch black beer with small beige head. Dense aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, cocoa, vanilla, some toasted coconut, spices. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter, strong dark chocolate, espresso, vanilla, traces of toasted coconut, whiskey, roasty, some chili in the bitter finish. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, aftertaste of coffee with notes of chili. Fantastic, powerful BA imperial stout, with strong dark chocolate character and well integrated spices. Awesome!

UPDATED: APR 17, 2017 Ocena przeniesiona z untapped w celu uzupełnienia profilu na ratebeer. Lane na wfp.

Update 16.04.2017.
Z butelki jeszcze lepsze. Może trochę mocniej wychodzi papryczka.

wielkie jest tu materii pomięszanie, ale to dobry, niemal wytrawny ris, co chwila wychodzi inny składnik w smaku, na szczęście papryczki najmniej. hieroglifów rebusowych na etykiecie niestety nie zrozumiałem.
W aromacie czekolada, beczka, papryczki, kawa. W smaku mega czekoladowo- waniliowe, posmaki papryczek, gładkie, gęste. Klasa piwo.

Rami Rami is drinking a Barrel Aged Bible Belt by Prairie Artisan Ales at Warszawski Festiwal Piwa

Wanilia, migal, swietne cialo, gladziutkie, czad piwo. Dziekuje, Pan Bucw ciagu festiwalu powtorzone 4 razy (raz butelka, 3 razy lane) - sumarycznie jakostam usredniona ocena, wrazenia zaleznie od okolicznosci ciut sie roznily, ale zawsze byly klasowe. Roznica np dotyczyczyla obecnosci badz braku obecnosci lekkich papryczek. Oraz generalnie balansu... tak czy inaczej liczba powtorek tez jakby o czyms swiadczy :)
bardzo kawowe, czuc tez sporo beczki, dobre ciało bardzo dobre, zwlaszcza dla fanow kawy

From tap. Pours a pitch black with a tan head. Aroma is of malt, sweet chili peppers, dark chocolate and whiskey. Taste is very sweet, with a slight bite from the chillies and some bitter dark chocolate. I would like less sweetness and more whiskey, but tasty none the less.
From tap. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty, caramelish and toasted malty, vanilla. Lingering dark malty. Bitter and roasted finish.

Tap @ fermentoren Aarhus. Aroma of vanilla, dark chocolate, coffee, whisky, light boozy. Black with tan head. Taste is moderate- malt and moderate sweet. Full body, smooth light boozy feel and dark chocolate light whisky booze finish.

Beczka w aromacie konkretna. Du?o wanilii, czekolady, bardzo intensywny aromat. Odrobina espresso. Piana be?owa, do ostatniego ?yka. W smaku du?o sie dzieje. Jest gesto, aksamitne, duzo czeko, wanilii. Na finiszu mocne espresso. Alko niestety troche nieu?o?one. Fajne, z?o?one, bardzo dobre piwo.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2017 Tap @ Fermentoren Aarhus, 13%. Black with medium dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, notes of vegetables, dark chocolate, very sweet, vanilla, bourbon, little dark fruit and a little bitter.

Tap: 4.1 Bottle: 4.3

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours pitch black with a creamy brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, coffee, little green cofffee, light chillies, light wood, little vanilla and bourbon. Flavor is sweet, rich malty, caramel, rich chocolate, wood, light chillies, vanilla, bourbon, light alcohol. Medium to full body, light oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation, light warming alcohol. 080417

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus fødselsdagsfest. Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, chocolate, vanilla, wood, bourbon, coffee and has a nice smooth light boozy finish. Yummy.

Bottle shared in Warsaw with the crew - sourced this one from the fest. Pours oily black-brown with a slim, creamy tan head. Really dense aroma, lots of baking cocoa, booze, raisins. Medium to big sweet flavour, huge character, some dried berries, oily vanilla, fudge. Full bodied, chewy, with fine carbonation. Lightly warming finish, more big and well rounded chocolate, moderate baking cocoa bitterness, some boozy warmth, leathery berries, vanilla, burnt toffee. Excellent beer. Supremely well depthed and balanced.

Bottle shared in the flat in Warsaw.. An oily black brown coloured pour, lasting dark tan head. Aroma is big coconut,,, toasted coconut, marshmallow. Flavour is composed of sweet peanut butter, coconut, vanilla. Palate is medium sweet, coconut,. Palate is sweet and sticky, moderate carbonation really nice.

Bottle split at Warsaw Man Cave, with the bros, 07/04/17. 
Pitch black topped with a dirty tan head.
Nose is sweet malts, figgy, chocolate, black peppery spice, mollastic tang, fruit cake bangaroo.
Taste comprises chocolate melt, light spice, brown sugar melties, black peppery spice, mellow bourbon rinse.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, drying close with a boosty huzzar !
Solid BA Impy Boost Jus .... hats to the off !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: APR 7, 2017 Bottle at the Warsaw debauchery fart fest 2017, with Theydon_Bois, Leighton, mrfr0g and WingmanWillis. Opaque black liquid with small to medium tan head. Aroma of bourbon, raw sugar, raisins, light wood, licorice, coffee and vanilla. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with notes of coffee, vanilla, raw sugar, raisins, bourbon and light wood. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Awesome.

Bottle at the Warsaw beer raking man cave. Pours black with a red brown hue and a dirty tan head that soon dissipates. Aroma is cocoa, coconut, boozy dark fruits. Taste is chocolate, coconut, marshmallow, the barrel ageing cones through with a lovely smooth finish with just a hint of booze. Really good stuff
Tap. Jet black, lots of chocolate, vanila and cocoa in aroma. Even more in taste, with some coconut and slighty warming. Absolutely awesome RIS

black colour, minimal, short living dark brown head; aroma of coffee, hot chocolate, vanilla, herbal liqueur, some whisky and chili notes, maybe some minimal coconut, too; taste of dark chocolate, coffee, syrupy sweetness, vanilla and intensive chili hot spiciness especially in the aftertaste; amazing imperial stout!

Piwo czarne, piana w postaci beżowej obrączki. W aromacie kawa, kakao, praliny, kokos, wanilia. Ogólnie bardzo przyjemny. W smaku kawa, czekolada,kakao, kokos, wanilia, na finiszu rozgrzewające chilli i goryczka. Nie kocham risów z ostrymi papryczkami, więc bez nich ten byłby idealny, ale i tak bardzo mi smakował.

Draft. A black beer with a brown head. The aroma has notes roasted malt, whisky, wood, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, dark chocolate, alcohol, and whisky, leading to dry finish.

Dark brown, nearly black, body with a small, oily beige collar. Aromas of chocolate, vanilla, chili peppers, Bakers chocolate. Low carbonation and smooth on the palate. Strong bourbon barrel presence. Prevalent sweetness. Prairie strikes again.

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! Poured into a snifter showing pitch black and no head. 

The nose shows a strong bourbon barrel forwardness with a bed of dark roasted malts. 

The palate is medium bodied and barely any carbonation. Strong alcoholic spice, very bourbon forward through out with very light roasted malt backbone.

On tap at hopaholic. Pitch black colour, head disappears immediately. Nose is whiskey, light smoke, cocoa. Taste is strong whiskey and cocoa, light vanilla. Amazing smoothness. Perfectly hidden alcohol. Lovely.

Draught at Himmeriget.
Pitch black colored with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of caramel and chocolate with notes of whisky.
Roasted flavor of caramel and chocolate with notes of dried fruits and whisky.
Roasted finish.

355 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 13%. Black colour, minimal tan head. Strong aroma of molasses, fusel, vanilla, whiskey and oak. Minimal carbonation. Rich and sweet flavour, notes of roast malts, sweetened coffee, molasses, chocolate, vanilla, whiskey and oak, hints of spices. .
Bottle. Great beer, lots of vanilla, coffee and chocolate in aroma. Very thick beer, oily, smooth. In taste vanilla, lots of bourbon, coconut in aftertaste. Superb.

Pitch black color with a ring of mocha foam. Aroma has coffee and chocolate pralines filled with some liquor. Taste has sweet chocolate, spices, mostly cinnamon but not too intense. Finishes very well balanced with sweet chocolate and roasted malt bitterness. Medium body, low carbonation, a bit of alcohol warmth. Really nice one, very similar with Bomb with extra whiskey flavors.

Bottle shared. Pitch black pour with a thin dark tan head with poor retention. Notes of dark chocolate, cold brewed coffee, bourbon, tons of vanilla, caramel, spices, cocoa, more chocolate. Full body, low carbonation, sticky sweet finish.

Kolor:  Czarny, nieprzejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Niska, krótka i kompletne nietrwała. Beżowa wstążeczką z wielkim sykiem znika z pola widzenia. 
Na całe szczęście pozostaje milimetrowy kołnierzyk.
Na ściankach szkła nie ma nawet jednej kropeczki. 
 Zapach:  Od pierwszych niuchów czuć wysoką słodycz tego RIS-a.
Do nosa dochodzą akcenty czekolady deserowej, kawy z mleczną pianką, karmelu i delikatnej wanilii.
Troszeczkę z boku zaczyna przypominać o sobie beczka po whiskey, żeby od razu utwierdzić w przekonaniu z jakim trunkiem mamy do czynienia.
Po zakręceniu buteleczką można wyczuć akcenty pikantnych dodatków (pieprz cayenne i papryczki chilli).
Kręci w nosie, że aż człowiek ma ochotę kichnąć.
Super aromat. Intensywny, trwały, taki jakiego oczekiwałem w tego rodzaju Imperialnych Stoutach. 
 Smak:  W smaku mega kawowe i dosadnie czekoladowe. Taka kawa latte oblana gęstą czekoladą.
Beczka po whisky równoważy słodycz karmelu, kakao, ciemnych owoców, śliwek w czekoladzie, czy beczułek czekoladowych z likierem w środku.
Dopiero na ostatniej prostej następuje zderzenie z pikanterią papryczek chilli. Dla miłośników tego typu dodatków mam złą wiadomość. Chilli jet tutaj tylko szczypta. W związku z tym faktem piwo staje się bardziej przyswajalne, nieco łagodniejsze, ale też świetnie zbalansowane zarazem.
Łatwiej mu trafić do szerszego grona odbiorców.
Papryczki nie przytłaczają bazy, są jedynie taką wisienką na torcie. A tort ten jest z całą pewnością kawowo-czekoladowy.
Piwo ma nieskazitelną strukturę.
Poziom procentowy utrzymany na doskonałym poziomie. Nie jest to żaden mięczak, a 13%-owy mocarz.
Alkohol rozgrzewa od środka, a jego ciepło scala się w całość z odczuciem pikanterii popryczkowej. 
Brakuje mi tutaj trochę dębiny i więcej waniliowych detali, ale to w końcu whisky, a nie bourbon.
Wspaniała pijalność!
Definitywnie strzał w dziesiątkę! 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Takie kolaboracje to ja lubię najbardziej. Evil Twin we współoracy z Prairie Artisans uwarzył piwo, które nie zawiedzie nawet największych sceptyków stylu.
Beczka po whisky nie przytłoczyła piwa bazowego, a co ważniejsze papryczki nie spowodowały uczucie nadmiernego pieczenia w gardle i przełyku. 
Balans poszczególnych składowych został pieczołowicie dopracowany.
Nic tutaj nie wychodzi przed szereg.
Alkohol jest rozgrzewający, ale powoduje łagodny odbiór.
Piwo ma niebotyczną pijalność i 
gładkie odczucie w ustach.
Prairie jak zwykle nie zawodzi!
Nie wiem czy spotkałem jakiekolwiek piwo z tego browaru, które mi jeszcze nie smakowało. 
Pyszne! Cieszę się, że mam jeszcze jedną buteleczkę ;)))

Atak papryki. Świeżej, czerwonej, sproszkowanej, ostrej, słodkiej, chili. Do tego czekolada - gorzka i kawa. Wspaniały aromat. Piana jest. niezbyt trwała ale wyraźna.
Piwo niezbyt treściwe.
Fajne do długiego posiedzenia i delktowania się. Sporo doznań.

Bottle. Light pepper character on the aroma. Faint barrel. Light vanilla. Pitch black. Small brown head. Taste is lightly pepper. Lots of vanilla and cocoa. Smooth. Almost slick. Light coffee. Not bad. No alcohol warming. Pretty good but not great.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2017 Bottle @ Flask, Århus. Thanks to MosterMette. Pours black with a creamy beige head and lacings. Roast, warmth, spices and coffee. Smooth, a bit low carbonation with a roasted bitter finish. Quality as always with Prairie Ales. Tap @ Dunkbar a few weeks later. Mega smooth with a better more profound quality of barrel. 4,1-4,3

Much like its non-BA brother, Barrel-Aged Bible Belt deserves a higher rating, but, man, this beer just looks terrible, flat with little head and no lace. Aromas friggin great, though, like sniffing a bottle of Hersheys Special Dark Syrup. Not much whiskey, but thats kinda the deal with this brew: very restrained, very sweet, and lacking any pronounced whiskey barrel notes. In fact, barrel aging kinda mellows Bible Belt too far; the chili peppers lose their bite, leaving too much room for the chocolate sweetness to take over. Finishes sweet, a mild hoppiness fighting off any cloy notes, yet the whiskey and oak are faint, background elements lost amid the chocolate onslaught. Dont get me wrong: this beers delicious. But the originals the superior version.

Barwa czarna, brak piany. Aromat kakao, czekolada, Bourbon, wanilia. Wspaniały. W smaku praliny czekoladowe, kawa, wanilia, orzechy. Lekki posmak porządnej whisky. Po chwili wychodzi posmak papryczki. Lekko grzeje w przełyk. Pifko świetnie zbalansowane. Petarda!!!
On tap at Biercab. Black colour with small brown head. Vanilla and whiskey aroma. Sweet, vanilla, chocolate, caramel, whiskey taste. Medium to full body.
Mnóstwo czekolady, sporo beczki, nieźle zamaskowany alkohol. Bardzo dobry RIS.

Bottle from Cap Tap. Pours dark brown with a transient tan head and a complex aroma that includes treacle, chocolate, coffee and vanilla. There is an equally complex flavor that includes the same plus a peppery finish.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours dark brown with a very transient dark tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, chili and whiskey. Full bodied. Flavor is chocolate, coffee, whiskey, chili and smooth dark malt. Not dry. Not bitter. Very flavorful. Good stuff indeed.
Mnóstwo kawy, bardzo palona, lekko kwaśna. W smaku słodko, kawowo, mocna paloność. W tle lekko waniliowo - beczkowe, bardzo fajnie ułożone.

Really thick jet black color with almost no head. Some slight toasted oak, vanilla, spices, cinnamon and molasses in the aroma. Velvety mouthfeel, slight spices with nice sweetness that was missing in the original bible belt. Full bodied, somewhat sticky. Very nice

Really balanced beer. Barrel is not very strong in aroma and strong, but vanilla notes are present. Roast, bitterness and coffee is well balanced and nice on tongue. Carbonation on spot! Extraordinary beer.

Butelka. Barwa smoliscie czarna. Brak piany. W aromacie duzo kakoa, czekolady, lekki kokos. Po dobrym ogrzaniu czuc wpływ beczki ma piwo. Bardzo dobrze wyczuwalna whiskey, bourbon, wanilie. Konsystencja oleista, lepka, wyklejajaca usta, ogólna slodycz. Duzo kakao, czekolady, pralin czekoladowowych, orzechy. Przyjemnie zaznaczona beczka. Nisko nasycone, goryczka niewysoka. Przyjemnie zalegające posmaki głównie kakao i whiskey. Delikatne grzanie alko (raczej nie jest to zasługa chilli- na cale szczęście). Fenomenalna pijalnosc jak na tak duzy woltaz.

Hmm, nie znam się :). Piany brak, aromat beczki jakoś do mnie nie doleciał...
Fajnie gęste i treściwe, ale przyprawy zdominowały wszystko... Nie podeszło.

More chocolate and less coffee than Bomb. And unlike Barrel Aged Bomb, not an improvement on the base.
Spice shines through a little, but this is definitely over alcoholic and over barreled. Still delicious, just not in the same category as BA Bomb.

Aroma stupendo. Intense, sulle prime, le note legnose del bourbon, dolci con sottofondo di tabacco. Poi vanilla, cioccolata fondente, caffè freddo shakerato, dolcezza inconfondibile ed anche un sottofondo di cocco tostato. Complesso, intenso e pulito, il naso è bellissimo. Nera come la notte, impenetrabile e con un cappuccio marrone appena visibile. Birra decisamente dolce sulle prime , caffè e cioccolata, chicchi di caffè ricoperti da cioccolata, poi vaniglia e toststure, cocco. Sul finale il calore del bourbon, le note legnose, ed un po di peperoncino sul finire. Anche tabacco e caffè che ritorna, per una grossa esplosione di sapori. È molto ben bilanciata, avrei preferito una birra più dolce ricordando la versione normale, ma va bene così. setosa e cremosa in bocca, accarezza il palato prima di sprigionare il ritorno di caffè e peperoncino. Davvero una grande bevuta. Ben fatta.

Waanzin!!! Heerlijk. Alles is werkelijk tot in de perfectie uitgebalanceerd. Boozy, maar niet té, chili maar enkel in functie van een warm mondgevoel, koffie maar niet teveel, geroosterd maar met mate, volle chocolade, vol mondgevoel. Dik, vol, plakkerig, romig. Absolute klasse.

The aroma is full of chocolate, coffee, fudge, caramel, smoke, tar and vanilla. The color is pitch black and there is no head. The taste is full of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, fudge, caramel, brownie, cacao nibs, chili peppers, muffin and booze. A nice beer!

W aromacie dużo kokosa i gorzkiej czekolady, delikatna bourbonowa wanilia również się przewija. Smak zdecydowanie #teamsłodyczka, słodka czekolada i wanilia. Później delikatnie grzeję w przełyk alkohol połączony z chilli. Bardzo fajne piwo, beczka pięknie pozostawiła swój ślad.

EBF 2017. Pours a very dark brown with a beige rim on top that leaves good lacing. Nose is really coffee forward with some.chocolate in the back and some unfortunate ash. Taste is more of the intense coffee but not ashy this time, just really intensely roasted. Moka. Body is full, carbonation low and mouthfeel is rich and sticky. Another solid imperial stout by Prairie! The barrel aging was not so evident but it was still very nice regardless.

5200th review! 12 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 1/2/2017. Pours dense pitch black color with a small dense dark tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin lace cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of huge milk/dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, fudge, molasses, brown sugar, caramel, toffee, vanilla, cream, cinnamon, chili peppers, marshmallow, bourbon, toasted oak, and dark bread; with lighter notes of coconut, tobacco, licorice, dark fruit, smoke, char, and roast/toast/oak earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malts, cocoa, coffee, spice, and bourbon barrel notes; with big strength. Taste of huge milk/dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, fudge, molasses, brown sugar, caramel, toffee, vanilla, cream, cinnamon, chili peppers, marshmallow, bourbon, toasted oak, and dark bread; with lighter notes of coconut, tobacco, licorice, dark fruit, smoke, char, and roast/toast/oak earthiness. Light roasted bitterness and bourbon/oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of milk/dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, fudge, molasses, brown sugar, caramel, toffee, vanilla, cream, cinnamon, chili peppers, marshmallow, bourbon, toasted oak, dark bread, light smoke, and roast/toast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malts, cocoa, coffee, spice, and bourbon barrel flavors; with an awesome roasted bitter/sweet balance, and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and very full body; with a very smooth, rich, and creamy/silky/velvety mouthfeel that is perfect. Minimal chalky roast, spice stickiness, or dryness. Alcohol is very well hidden; a light warmth lingering after the finish, with minimal barrel booziness. Zero lingering pepper heat or spice. Overall this is an insane barrel aged spiced imperial stout! All around amazing complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malts, cocoa, coffee, spice, and bourbon barrel flavors; very smooth and dangerously easy to sip on for the huge ABV. Mind blowing levels of rich complexities. Perfectly balanced between all flavor components; with one the smoothest/silkiest mouthfeels Ive ever had in any stout of this ABV. Great barrel presence without being boozy or tannic. Absolutely world class offering all around.

Pours dark, opaque, minimal brown head. Lovley coffee aroma, lots of cocoa, chillies, some vanilla, pralines, cherry liqour, hint of bourbon, roast. dominate flavour is bitterness, but also there are notable signs of sweetness and sourness. Suprisingly big carbonation, extreme oily, long roasty finish, full body of course, nice feeling of alcohol in throat.
Thick like motor oil. No head. Smells amazing, like chocolate and chillis. Tastes like it smells. Thick fudge with non spicy peppers, mild coffee. Vanilla icing at the end.  Coats the glass.

Black in color with a tan head. Sweet chocolate aroma, with boozy whisky notes. Super Sweet chocolately flavor, light bodied, bourbon notes, warming boozy finish.

Middle has massive roasted malts, coffee, and milky sweetness. Finishes with toffee, toasted nuts, spice, and oak. Full body, tongue-coating, sticky, no carb; boozy heat from front to back. Absolutely beautiful beer; unbelievably delicious.

Wspaniały i intensywny aromat, dominuje w nim czekolada kawowa, są pralinki, jest whiskey, jest wanilia. Ciemnobrunatne i nieprzejrzyste, bez piany. W smaku jeszcze większe bogactwo, na pierwszym planie są wiśnie w czekoladzie wymoczone w whiskey, jest też bardzo wyraźne kakao, jest kawa, jest wanilia dodana z mistrzowskim umiarem, jest beczka, whiskey daje mocno,ale nie w sposób przesadzony. Pours blackish with a shiny mocha head. Aroma has big coffee, fudge and pepper. The bourbon is second fiddle no doubt. Nice aroma, even some good booze coming through. The taste is pretty intense with roasted and savoury malt, charred oak, green pepper and reeses peanut butter cups. Long roasted, booze aftertaste, soft carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Good overall.

Aroma is sweet boozy chocolate , taste is the same, whiskey notes too harsh, not very well balanced, aftertaste is a bit out of the profile and thin. A little bit of dissapointment, i would prefer the base beer even more jesus.
Tons and tons of lovely whisky on top of all the spices that already dominate this lovely beer. Good as expected.
A very solid imperial stout. Rich and dark. Boozy and chocolatey. Light licorice and thick molasses finish.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is dark chocolate, vanilla, some bourbon. Taste is dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, mild spice. The abv is well hidden. Smooth mouth feel, bigger body, very tasty. Very solid imperial stout.

Bottled at Clubhouse BFD event. Probably 2016 vintage. Pours black, tan head. Aroma is bourbon, chocolate, pepper, vanilla, coconut. Flavor is bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, booze, pepper, coffee. Excellent. Loving this one.

From tap (or botle) at Ratebeer Best festival, Santa Rosa. Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, cocoa, some coffee, caramel, vanilla, dark dried fruits, wood, alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full silky oily body with soft carbonation.
12oz bottle shared by Big Lou, thanks buddy! Dark pour. Dry roasted spice aroma. Taste follows, slight chillies, not super hot. Really good.
Bottle from Lou - thanks! Motor oil pour. Rich chocolate and peppers on aroma and taste. Boozy and slick.

on tap at extreme beer fest 2017, boston. unclear almost oily black with a reviving creamy dark cream head, sticky lacing. good amount of coffee, bitter cacao grains, some sweetness - molasses and burnt honey; maple syrup flakes, raisins, eau-de-vie alcohol, wood - never too bourbony, little to no chili heat. moderately low carbonation, medium to full body - very oily; hot almost cloying spicy finish. like a nice cold brewed coffee in a bitter hot chocolate - with subtle barrel woody notes.

Fresh bottle. Dark, oily black. Nose is a bourbon fudge brownie, super rich. Taste is sweet with a slick mouthfeel and warming booze finish but not overly hot. Flavor is rich fudge brownie, some sweet bourbon and vanilla. Incredible stuff.

12 oz. big thanks to RobertDale.
Opaque dark dark brown. Aroma is chocolate frosty with a touch of whisky. Taste is vanilla, chocolate, malt, brownies. A touch of spice as it warms. Thick body that coats your mouth with flavor. Really tasty.

New beer #10 at EBF. Bottle pour. Black pour with tan head. Sweet vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, oak, chili peppers, whiskey and coffee aromas. Flavors are sweet, spicy, chocolate, vanilla, whiskey and coffee tones.

Pours an opaque dark brown color almost black like oil with similar viscosity and khaki colored head. Barrel character, oak, whiskey, vanilla, coffee, cocoa, and roasted malt on the nose; follows onto the palate. Full bodied. Finishes with much of the above and the chili comes in with a little heat on the finish.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate vanilla chili aroma. Roasted malty smooth chocolate chili vanilla spicy woody flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate spicy chili vanilla finish.
Bottle pour at RateBeer Best 2017. Black with tan head. Aromas of caramel, dark chocolate, whiskey. Tastes of dark chocolate, caramel, sweet whiskey, oak. Full body with a dry finish. Really good.

The most recent "vintage" Pour to white wine glass I broke my snifter :( pitch pour with ephemeral head. Nose of fudge-drenched vanilla, with thin, yet stalwart underlying notes of pepper skin, coffee, a Cookie Crisp cereal, and cinnamon. Flavor is big dark chocolate and coffee, very mild vanilla. A balance between a finely slick-oily texture with enough grippy-ness that the coffee, cocoa, and barrel notes hold onto, just by the skin of their teeth. Once again, Prairie brandishes their stout skills with flying colors, even in collaboration. Its easy to tell, by the nose and flavor, their Bomb! side of the collab pretty easy overrided the Even More Jesus, and even most of the barrel notes. But still, WONDERFUL.

12 oz bottle. Pours pitch black with a beige head... Bottle at RBBest. Pours pitch black. Aroma is strong coffee and vanilla, also bourbon barrel. Body is heavy, strong and boozy, with a lot of barrel. Smooth, creamy and sticky. Long caramel palate. Delicious!
12 ounce bottle. Pours black with a decent tan head. Aroma of bourbon, chocolate, and malt. Taste is bourbon, dark chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla, and coffee. Very good.

Full bodied and thick with soft carbonation. Drying, coffee bitterness finish.

There is a light smokiness and a good chocolate and coffee balance throughout. The carbonation is soft and the aftertaste is solid. This is a good beer.
